post_text: BEARCAT FANS! It is that time of year again...Bearcat Sports Time! We know you are excited about coming out to cheer on your Bearcats, and we greatly appreciate the fan support. Due to the current situation throughout our country, we are working to minimize COVID risks at events. Our gymnasium will be divided with a Home side and a Visitor side to reduce exposure. We have also implemented additional disinfecting measures throughout the gymnasium, concession area, and restrooms. We ask that you do your part to protect other fans and our athletes. Please practice safe social distancing where possible. Masks are strongly recommended. If you are not feeling well, please do not attend. We look forward to seeing you, but only after you are feeling better. We are planning on live streaming games on our Facebook page for those who cannot attend in person. Thank you in advance Bearcat Nation for helping us minimize risks associated with COVID.
text: BEARCAT FANS! It is that time of year again...Bearcat Sports Time! We know you are excited about coming out to cheer on your Bearcats, and we greatly appreciate the fan support. Due to the current situation throughout our country, we are working to minimize COVID risks at events. Our gymnasium will be divided with a Home side and a Visitor side to reduce exposure. We have also implemented additional disinfecting measures throughout the gymnasium, concession area, and restrooms. We ask that you do your part to protect other fans and our athletes. Please practice safe social distancing where possible. Masks are strongly recommended. If you are not feeling well, please do not attend. We look forward to seeing you, but only after you are feeling better. We are planning on live streaming games on our Facebook page for those who cannot attend in person. Thank you in advance Bearcat Nation for helping us minimize risks associated with COVID.

post_text: We are looking forward to starting the 2020-2021 school year on Monday, August 24!!! Students may arrive at 7:35am and classes will begin at 7:58am. All elementary students, Preschool through 6th grade, will enter at the elementary entrance. All 7th through 12th graders will enter at the main entrance. No parents and/or guardians will be allowed to enter with their students. You may drop them off at the door. Our teachers will be waiting to greet them! Also, if at all possible, please send your student with a water bottle. Thank you!
text: We are looking forward to starting the 2020-2021 school year on Monday, August 24!!! Students may arrive at 7:35am and classes will begin at 7:58am. All elementary students, Preschool through 6th grade, will enter at the elementary entrance. All 7th through 12th graders will enter at the main entrance. No parents and/or guardians will be allowed to enter with their students. You may drop them off at the door. Our teachers will be waiting to greet them! Also, if at all possible, please send your student with a water bottle. Thank you!

post_text: Lesterville Fall Baseball practice will begin on Monday, August 10th and will last from 8:00-10:30am. A water cooler will be provided, but players are encouraged to bring their own water bottles/jugs. All student-athletes must have an up-to-date physical on file prior to beginning practice. Please email any questions to Coach Hathcoat at jhathcoat@lesterville.k12.mo.us

post_text: After much consideration and recommendations from local health officials the Lesterville PTO has made the decision to postpone the 2020 Fall Festival at this time due to the COVID pandemic. If you have any questions, please feel free to private message the PTO Facebook page or contact PTO Secretary Candace Lanham at (573) 778-6893.

post_text: In an attempt to follow CDC guidelines, we will not be having open house this year. Registration packets for current students will be made available at a later time. If you are new to our district, please call either the elementary or high school office from 8:00am-2:00pm beginning August 3, 2020 to schedule a time to register.

post_text: As of July 15, 2020, Lesterville School plans on starting the 2020-2021 school year on August 24, 2020. We are currently developing a plan for the school year in regards to Covid-19. Upon completion, our reentry plan will be made available to the public. We will continue to post updates as we solidify plans for upcoming events and the 2020-2021 school year. Check back with us daily for information regarding our Open House and registration.

Check back with us daily for information regarding our Open House and registration.

post_text:
UPDATE FOR LESTERVILLE GRADUATION 2020:

Based on Gov. Parsons' announcement lifting statewide restrictions, the decision has been made to remove the limit on the number of guests allowed to attend the Graduation Ceremony on Friday, June 19th at 7pm.

Tickets will no longer be required to attend. We do want to remind all who would consider attending that there remains a community risk as a result of the COVID epidemic. Please keep in mind the following safety measures:

If you are sick we ask that you not attend.
If you have underlying health conditions that place you at risk, please protect yourself and stay at home.

We highly recommend that everyone in attendance wear a mask as maintaining social distincancing may not be possible in a large crowd.

We are still planning on live streaming the ceremony for the convenience of those who choose not to attend.

After polling the seniors, we have decided to not have the parade prior to graduation.
text:
UPDATE FOR LESTERVILLE GRADUATION 2020:

Based on Gov. Parsons' announcement lifting statewide restrictions, the decision has been made to remove the limit on the number of guests allowed to attend the Graduation Ceremony on Friday, June 19th at 7pm.

Tickets will no longer be required to attend. We do want to remind all who would consider attending that there remains a community risk as a result of the COVID epidemic. Please keep in mind the following safety measures:

If you are sick we ask that you not attend.
If you have underlying health conditions that place you at risk, please protect yourself and stay at home.

We highly recommend that everyone in attendance wear a mask as maintaining social distincancing may not be possible in a large crowd.

We are still planning on live streaming the ceremony for the convenience of those who choose not to attend.

After polling the seniors, we have decided to not have the parade prior to graduation.

post_text: There were a lot of art projects left in the art room when school unexpectedly closed in March. If you have a project you would like, Mrs. White will be there from 9:00-3:00 on Thursday, June 18th. You may pick up your project at that time.

post_text:
The Lesterville Class of 2020 Graduation Ceremony will be held on Friday, June 19th at 7pm.
Each graduating senior has been given tickets and only those with a ticket will be allowed inside. We will live steam the ceremony for those unable to attend.
In addition, the seniors will parade through town at approximately 5:45pm (weather permitting). Please come out and help us recognize our seniors and let them see your Bearcat pride.

In addition, the seniors will parade through town at approximately 5:45pm (weather permitting). Please come out and help us recognize our seniors and let them see your Bearcat pride.

post_text:
Attention all Junior High and High School Students:
We will be at school on Tuesday, May 12th from 8am to 3pm. If you did not make it up to school to get your belongings, you may do so during that time. Please call the school before arriving and we will bring your stuff out to you. If you have your textbooks or library books, you should return them during this time.

Seniors - Your t-shirts that People’s Community Bank bought for you are in and can be picked up on Tuesday, May 12th from 8am to 3pm. Please call the school before arriving.

Report Cards and Bills - We will be mailing your report cards and bills this week.

Way to go!

post_text:
COVID-19
Health and Wellness Closure Extended
After consultation with State and local health officials, Lesterville R-IV School District is extending the COVID-19 Health and Wellness closure through April 30, 2020. This decision was made in accordance with the President’s Executive Order on social distancing and advice from health officials. All scheduled school activities during the closure are cancelled. The Junior/Senior Prom scheduled for April 18th is cancelled. Teachers will continue to make phone contacts, post lessons and activities, and provide instructional support through this extended closure. Please abide by the social distancing order. We will provide updates as they become available. Thank you for your cooperation and patience through this unprecedented ordeal. Be safe.
text:
COVID-19
Health and Wellness Closure Extended
After consultation with State and local health officials, Lesterville R-IV School District is extending the COVID-19 Health and Wellness closure through April 30, 2020. This decision was made in accordance with the President’s Executive Order on social distancing and advice from health officials. All scheduled school activities during the closure are cancelled. The Junior/Senior Prom scheduled for April 18th is cancelled. Teachers will continue to make phone contacts, post lessons and activities, and provide instructional support through this extended closure. Please abide by the social distancing order. We will provide updates as they become available. Thank you for your cooperation and patience through this unprecedented ordeal. Be safe.

post_text: Hello everyone! It's time for Spirit Week - VIRTUAL Spirit Week! We will start on Monday, March 30th. All you need to do is post your photos on Facebook with the hashtag #bearcatproud. You can also send your photos to me (Mrs. Freeman). This should be very easy, so let's have some fun and stay connected! Students, teachers, administrators and parents - this includes all of us! Post those pics and check daily!

post_text:
A message from Mrs. Freeman!
Any students grades PK - 3 who would like to access their abcmouse account; I have created a temporary username and password to help you.
1. Go to www.abcmouse.com
2. Login with username
afreeman@lesterville.k12.mo.us
password: vball
3. From there your child can find their account and have fun learning!

Also, any students who wish to stay sharp on their keyboarding and coding skills, please go to the sites we use.
www.code.org
www.typing.com

If you need help remembering your login, message me or email me and I will gladly get those for you.

I miss you all!!

post_text: Several juniors and seniors traveled to the 42nd annual high school art exhibition at the CRISP museum at SEMO. This year, 550 pieces of art were submitted by juniors and seniors from 37 different schools. Out of the 550 entries, only 110 pieces were selected to be displayed at the museum. Charleigh Lancaster had her charcoal drawing of a cat chosen to be displayed this year. Great job, Charleigh!

post_text: Very proud of all of our students at MO Beta Convention. We had three students place in the top 5 of their respective competition. Piper Fitzgerald placed 2nd in Division 1 (9th & 10th grade) Fiber Arts. Hallie Sieve placed 1st in Division 2 (11th & 12th grade) Fiber Arts. Gharret Wilcut placed 5th in 10th grade Social Studies. They’ll be headed to Fort Worth, Texas in June.

They’ll be headed to Fort Worth, Texas in June.

post_text:
Our Lady Bearcats received several post season honors for volleyball.
Reese Gray was selected to the BRL All Conference team, Class 1 District 5 1st Team All District team, and Class 1 All State team.
Mallory Polk was selected to the BRL All Conference team, Class 1 District 5 1st Team All District team, Class 1 All State team, BRL Player of the Year, and Big 3 Player of the Year.
Allie Harrison was selected to the BRL All Conference team and Class 1 District 5 1st Team All District.
Piper Fitzgerald was selected to the BRL All Conference team.
Also, Coach Middleton was selected as the BRL Coach of the Year.
Congratulations! We are proud of you all.

post_text: We will send a student-only Pep Bus to Summersville on Saturday, November 2nd if there are 30 students signed up. Students must pay $10 and they will get it back when they arrive at Summersville. Students must sign up and pay by 12 noon on Friday, November 1st. The bus will leave at 2:45pm on Saturday.

post_text:
DISTRICT SHIRTS!!
- $12.00 each
- short sleeve T-shirt
- All youth sizes are available, and adult small thru 4x.

To order: You MUST call central office (637-2201) at school BEFORE 3:00 pm tomorrow (Wednesday). If you can prepay, it is best. If not, you must agree to pick up your shirts and pay before sectionals on Saturday. They should be in on Friday. You may also come to school to order and prepay.
This is the shirt! The roster and record will be on the back.

post_text: October 8, 2019. 49 highway is blocked at approximately 2 miles from the 21 highway junction. We are holding the buses that travel 49 highway and J highway until we receive word that the road is clear. Children riding these routes will be held in the school cafeteria until the road is clear and ready to board buses. Amount of delay is unknown at this time. Thank you for your cooperation.

post_text: We kicked off our CATS time program this week. CATS time offers additional small group intervention for the four core subjects (Math, English, Science, Social Studies), a homework room for students to work on assignments, and enrichment classes. This block, our enrichment offerings included: Yoga, Baking, Shop, and Reading in the Library. Every 2 weeks, a new set of enrichment classes will be offered. Check out some of the pictures from the first few days.
